events.name: Donut event
events.description:
1st speaker
Andrzej Amanowicz, Senior Business Analyst

Presentation tittle:

Customers mostly like the ideas that have origin in their believes, experience and habits. It is much more effective to convince the customer to some idea or solution if he/she articulates this idea/solution and then believes that we are actually following his/her concepts.
This presentation focuses on the Discovery and Elicitation tasks and techniques with special attention to methods that are related to coaching. Coaching being originally part of personal development can be also used sales and in managing customer expectation. It is often defined as ‚Äúform of development in which a person called a coach supports a coachee (learner or client) in achieving a specific personal or professional goal by providing training and guidance.‚Äù. Let‚Äôs try to convience an Eskimo to buy a fridge!

Who is Andrzej?
He has been working in IT application business since 1995. Worked 15+ years for top application vendors and few years for big System Integrator gathering various experience in Business Analysis. Specialises in analyzing business processes of customer and transforming value of technology and applications into language of business users (ROI, TCO, process gap analysis etc.) as well as in managing customer expectations and requirements.
Have both business (Executive MBA) and IT education (MSc at Technical University Wroclaw), as well as Presales, Sales and Consulting experience. Experienced in working with C-level managers on customer side, finding their critical objectives and challenges and determining how modern technology can help address them. Have son and wife as well as dog passionate for mantrailing.

2nd speaker
Vladyslav Kozlovskyi, UX Designer

Presentation tittle:

He will share his experience of working with Atomic design system, explain the basics of using and building it, show the real cases. You will found out why it is useful for designers, frontend developers, QA's and even for the Clients.

Who is Vlad?
He is Web UX/UI Designer with 8 years of experience in a variety of projects startups and companies. Making full product research, analyzing business goals, user behavior and their needs, preparing high fidelity interactive prototypes, test and support the products after release. Currently focused on project design and development process improvement.

We would like to bring to life AUG Lower Silesia and start to meet regularly - three or four times a year.
